author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: مِنْ عِبادِكَ، إِذًا تَرَى غُرْبَتِيْ فِيْ أَيَّامِكَ وَاشْتِياقِيْ بِلِقائِكَ وَشَوْقِيْ إِلى سَاحَةِ عِزِّ فَرْدانِيَّتِكَ وَاهْتِزازِي مِنْ هُبُوبِ أَرْيَاحِ رَحْمَانِيَّتِكَ، أَسْئَلُكَ
translation: Thou beholdest, therefore, the exile which I suffer in Thy days, and art aware of my vehement longing to look upon Thy face, and of mine irrepressible yearnings to enter the court of Thy glory, and of the stirrings of my heart under the influences of the winds of Thy mercy.
